text: MAHARASHTRA   ACT  No.  XLVI  OF  1986. 1
label: H1

text: [T HE C ENTRAL I NDIA S PINNING , W EAVING AND M ANUFACTURING C OMPANY
label: body

text: L IMITED , T HE E MPRESS M ILLS , N AGPUR (A CQUISTION AND T RANSFER OF
label: body

text: U NDERTAKING )  A CT , 1986.]
label: body

text: [This Act received assent of the president on the 23rd day of December 1986 ;
label: body

text: assent  was first published in the Maharashtra Government Gazette,
label: body

text: Part IV, Extraordinary, on the 26th day of December, 1986.]
label: body

text: An Act to  provide  for  acquisition  and  transfer  of  undertaking  of  the Central  India
label: body

text: Spinning, Weaving  and  Manufacturing  Company  Limited,  with  a  view  to  securing
label: body

text: the  proper  management  of  such  undertaking  so  as  to  subserve  the   interest  of
label: body

text: the  general  public  by  ensuring  the continued  manufacture,  production  and  distribu-
label: body

text: tion  of  textile  and  paper  products  which are essential to the needs of the economy of
label: body

text: the  country  and  for  matters  connected  therewith  or  incidental  thereto.
label: body

text: WHEREAS, the Central India Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing Company Limited,
label: body

text: being an existing company as defined in clause (ii) of  sub-section (1) of section 3 of the
label: body

text: Companies Act, 1956, had been engagged in the manufacture and production of yarn, cloth
label: body

text: and paper through its undertaking which was composite textile mill and paper manufacturing
label: body

text: unit, styled as the Central India Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing Company Limited,
label: body

text: “The Empress Mills”, Nagpur ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, in Petition No. 183 of 1986 filed by the company for voluntary winding
label: body

text: up, the High Court of Bombay had made an order for appointment of the provisional liquida-
label: body

text: tor and the proceedings for its liquidation were pendings ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, the company had declared lock-out throwing about more
label: body

text: than 6,000 workers out of employment and the undertaking has not been functioning since
label: body

text: 3rd  May 1986 ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, it was expedient to acquire the undertaking of the said company to
label: body

text: ensure that the interest of the general public and of the employees of the undertaking were
label: body

text: served by the continuance, by the undertaking of the said company, of the manufacture,
label: body

text: production and distribution of textile and paper products which are essential to the needs of
label: body

text: the country and to provide for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, such acquisition is for giving effect to the policy of the State towards
label: body

text: securing the principle specified in clause (b) of Article 39 of the Constitution ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, both Houses of the State Legislature were not in session ;
label: body

text: I of
label: body

text: 1 For Statement of Objects and Reasons, see Maharashtra Government Gazette , 1986, Part V, Extra,
label: body

text: PP. 551–– 552, dated the 20th October 1986.
label: body

text: Mah.
label: body

text: Ord.
label: body

text: V of
label: body

text: Short title
label: body

text: and com-
label: body

text: mencement.
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, the Government of  Maharashtra was satisfied that circumstances
label: body

text: existed which rendered it necessary for him to take immediate action to make a law for the
label: body

text: puroposes aforesaid ; and, therefore, pomulgated the Central India Spinning, Weaving and
label: body

text: Manufacturing Company Limited, the Empress Mills, Nagpur (Acquisition and Transfer of
label: body

text: Undertaking) Ordinance, 1986, on the 3rd October 1986 ;
label: body

text: AND WHEREAS, it is expedient to replace the said Ordinance by an Act of the State
label: body

text: Legislature ; It is hereby enacted in the Thirty-seventh Year of the Republic of India as
label: body

text: follows :—
label: body

text: CHAPTER  I
label: H2

text: P RELIMINARY
label: H3

text: (1) This Act may be called the Central India Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing
label: body

text: Company Limited, the Empress Mills, Nagpur (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking)
label: body

text: (2) It shall be deemed to have come into force on the 3rd October 1986.
label: body

text: In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,—
label: body

text: (a) “appointed day” means the date of commencement of this Act ;
label: body

text: (b) “bank” means —
label: body

text: (i) the  State  Bank  of  India  constituted  under  the  State  Bank of  India
label: body

text: (ii) a Subsidiary Bank as defined in the State Bank of India (Subsidiary Banks)
label: body

text: (iii) a corresponding new bank constituted under section 3 of the Banking
label: body

text: Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970 or under
label: body

text: section  3 of the Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings)
label: body

text: (iv) any other bank, being a scheduled bank as defined in clause ( e ) of section 2 of
label: body

text: the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934 ;
label: body

text: (c) “Commissioner” means the Commissioner of Payment appointed
label: body

text: under section  14 ;
label: body

text: (d) “Corporation” means the Maharashtra State Textile Corporation, a Government
label: body

text: company registered under the Companies Act, 1956 ;
label: body

text: (e) “Instituition” means —
label: body

text: (i) The General Insurance Corporation formed under section 9 of the General
label: body

text: Insurance Business (Nationalisation) Act, 1972,
label: body

text: (ii) The Industrial Credit and Investment Corporation of India, a Company being
label: body

text: an existing Company as defined in clause (ii) of section 3 of the Companies
label: body

label: body

text: registered under the Companies Act, 1956, or
label: body

text: (ix) The Unit Trust of India established under section 3 of the Unit Trust of India Act,
label: body

text: (f) “new Government company” means a Government Company (including a subsidiary
label: body

text: Government Company) formed and registered under the Companies Act, 1956, in which the
label: body

text: undertaking is directed to vest under sub-section (1) of section 6 ;
label: body

text: (g) “prescribed” means prescribed by rules made under this Act ;
label: body

text: (h) “proprietors” means the Central India Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing
label: body

text: Company Limited, an existing company as defined in clause (ii) of sub-section (1) of
label: body

text: section 3 of the Companies Act, 1956 with Registered Office at Army and Navy Building,
label: body

text: 148, Mahatma Gandhi Road, Fort, Bombay -400 023 and includes the liquidator appointed
label: body

text: in petition No. 183 of 1986 in the Bombay High Court ;
label: body

text: (i) “Schedule” means the Schedule appended to this Act;
label: body

text: (j) “specified date”, in relation to a provision of this Act, means such date as the
label: body

text: State Government may, by notifiaction in the Official Gazette , specify for the purposes
label: body

text: of that provision, and different dates may be specified for different provisions of this
label: body

text: Act ;
label: body

text: (k) “undertaking” means the industrial undertaking known as “the Central India
label: body

text: Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing Company Limited, ‘the Empress Mills’, Nagpur”;
label: body

text: (l) words and expressions used herein and not defined, but defined in
label: body

text: the  Companies Act, 1956, shall have the meanings respectively assigned to them in
label: body

text: that Act.

text: CHAPTER  II
label: body

text: A CQUISITION AND T RANSFER OF THE U NDERTAKING
label: body

text: (1) On the appointed day, the undertaking and the right, title and interest of the
label: body

text: proprietors in relation to the unedertakings, shall, by virtue of this Act, stand transferred to,
label: body

text: and vest absolutely in, the State Government.
label: body

text: (2) The undertaking which stands vested in the State Government by virtue of
label: body

text: sub-section (1) shall, immediately after it has so vested, stand transferred to, and vested in,
label: body

text: the Corporation.
label: body

text: (1) The undertaking shall be deemed to include all assets, rights, lease-holds,
label: body

text: powers, authorities and privileges, and all property, moveable and immoveable,  including
label: body

text: lands, buildings, workshops, stores, instruments, machinery and   equipment, cash balances,
label: body

text: cash on hand, reserve funds, investments, book debts and all other rights and interests, in or
label: body

text: arising out of, such property as were immediately before the appointed day in the ownership,
label: body

text: possession, power or control of the proprietors, whether within or outside India, and all
label: body

text: books of account, registers and all other documents of whatever nature relating thereto.
label: body

text: All properties as aforesaid which have vested in the State Government under sec-
label: body

text: tion 3 shall, by force of such vesting, be freed and discharged from any trust, obligation,
label: body

text: mortgage, charge, lien and all other encumbrances affecting them, and any
label: body

text: attachment, injunction, decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority restricting
label: body

text: the use of such properties in any manner shall be deemed to have been withdrawn.
label: body

text: Every mortgagee of any property which has vested under this Act in the State
label: body

text: Government and every person holding any charge, lien or other interest in, or in relation, to
label: body

text: any such property shall give, within such time and in such manner as may be prescribed, an
label: body

text: intimation to the Commissioner of such mortagage, charge, lien or other interest.
label: body

text: For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that the mortgagee of any property
label: body

text: referred to in sub-section (3) or any other person holding any charge, lien or other interest
label: body

text: in, or in relation to, any such property shall be entitled to claim, in accordance with his rights
label: body

text: and interest, payment of the mortgage money or other dues, in whole or in part, out of the
label: body

text: amount specified in section 7 and also out of the amounts referred to in section 8, but no
label: body

text: such mortgage, charge, lien or other interest shall be enforceable against any such property
label: body

text: which has vested in the State Government, the Corporation or new Government company.
label: body

text: Any licence or other instrument granted to the proprietors in relation to  the undertak-
label: body

text: ing  which  has  vested  in  the  State  Government  under  section   3, at any time before the
label: body

text: appointed day and in force immediately before that day, shall continue to be in force on
label: body

text: and after such day in accordance with its tenor in relation to, and for the purposes  of such
label: body

label: body

text: undertaking, and on and from the date of vesting of such undertaking under section 3 in the
label: body

text: Corporation, or under section 6 in the new Government company, the Corporation, or new
label: body

text: government company, as the case may be, shall be deemed to be substituted in such licence
label: body

text: or other instrument as if such Licence or other instrument had been granted to the  Corpora-
label: body

text: tion, or new Government company, and that the  Corporation, or the new Government
label: body

text: company, shall hold it for the remainder of the period for which the proprietors would have
label: body

text: held it under the terms thereof.
label: body

text: (1) Every liability of the proprietors in relation to the undertaking in respect of any
label: body

text: period prior to the appointed day, shall be the liability of the proprietors and shall be enforce-
label: body

text: able against them and not against the State Government or against the Corporation or, where
label: body

text: the undertaking is directed under section 6 to vest, in a new Government company, against
label: body

text: the new Government company.
label: body

text: (2) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that.—
label: body

text: (a) save as otherwise expressly provided in this section or in any other provision of
label: body

text: this Act, no liability, shall be enforceable against the State Government or the Corpora-
label: body

text: tion, or, where the undertaking is directed under section 6 to vest in any other new
label: body

text: Government company, against such new Government company ;
label: body

text: (b) no award, decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority in relation to the
label: body

text: undertaking passed on or after the appointed day, in respect of any matter, claim or
label: body

text: dispute, which arose before that day, shall be enforceable against the State government
label: body

text: or the Corporation or, where the undertaking is directed under section 6 to vest in any
label: body

text: other new Government company, against such new Government company ;
label: body

text: (c) no liability incurred by the proprietors before the appointed day, for the
label: body

text: contravention of any provision of any law for the time being in force, shall be enforceable
label: body

text: against the State Government or the Corporation, or where the undertaking is directed
label: body

text: under section 6 to vest in any other new Government company, against such new
label: body

text: Government company ;
label: body

text: (d) notwithstanding anything contained in sub-sections (1) and (2) of  section 12 or
label: body

text: any other provisions of this Act, or any other law for the time being in force or any
label: body

text: contract, agreement, settlement, award or decree or order of any court, tribunal or other
label: body

text: authority, no liability towards claims of whatever nature of any employee against the
label: body

text: proprietors in respect of his employment in the undertaking for the period prior to the
label: body

text: appointed day shall be enforceable against the State Government or the Corporation, or
label: body

text: where the undertaking is directed under section 6 to vest in any other new Government
label: body

text: company, against such new Government company.

label: body

text: (1) Notwithstanding anything contained in sections 3 and 4, where the undertaking
label: body

text: vests, under sub-section (2) of section 3, in the Corporation, the State Government may,
label: body

text: subject to such terms and conditions as it may think fit to impose, direct, by notification in
label: body

text: the Official Gazette, that the undertaking and the right title and interest of the proprietors in
label: body

text: relation to the undertaking, which had vested in the State Government and which on its
label: body

text: transfer vest in the Corporation under section 3, shall instead of continuing to vest in the
label: body

text: Corporation, vest in a new Government company with effect from the date specified in the
label: body

text: notification.
label: body

text: (2) Where the right, title and interest of the proprietors in relation to their undertaking
label: body

text: vest, under sub-section (1) , in the new Government company, such Government company
label: body

text: shall, on and from the date of such vesting, be deemed to have become the owner in relation
label: body

text: to such undertaking, and all the rights and liabilities of the State Government and the Corpo-
label: body

text: ration in relation to the undertaking shall, on and from the date of such vesting, be deemed
label: body

text: to have become the rights and liabilities of such Government company.
label: body

text: CHAPTER III
label: H2

text: P AYMENT OF A MOUNTS
label: H3

text: For the transfer to, and vesting in, the State Government under section 3, of the
label: body

text: undertaking and the right, title and interest of the proprietors in relation to the undertaking,
label: body

text: there shall be paid by the State Government to the proprietors, in cash, and in the manner
label: body

text: specified in Chapter VI, an amount of rupees six crores and ten lakhs :
label: body

text: Provided that, where any liability of the proprietors specified in the Schedule is
label: body

text: discharged by the State Government or the Corporation according to the order of the
label: body

text: priorities mentioned in the Schedule, the amount to be paid to the proprietors under this
label: body

text: section shall stand reduced to that extent.
label: body

text: ( 1 ) The amount payable in accordance with the provisions of section 7 shall carry
label: body

text: simple interest at the rate of four per cent.
label: body

text: per annum for the period commencing on the
label: body

text: appointed day and ending on the date on which payment of such amount is made by the
label: body

text: State Government to the Commissioner.
label: body

text: ( 2 ) The amount representing interest calculated at the rate specified in sub-section ( 1 )
label: body

text: shall be given by the State Government to proprietors in addition to the amount specified in
label: body

text: section 7.
label: body

text: ( 3 ) For the removal of doubts it is hereby declared that the liabilities of the proprietors in
label: body

text: relation to their undertaking which has vested in the State Government or the Corporation
label: body

text: under section 3 shall be discharged from the amounts specified in section 7 and also from the
label: body

text: amounts specified in sub-section (1) in accordance with the rights and interests of the
label: body

text: creditors of the proprietors.
label: body

text: CHAPTER IV

text: M ANAGEMENT , ETC . OF THE U NDERTAKING
label: H3

text: (1) The general superintendence, direction, contol and management of the affairs
label: body

text: and business of the undertaking, the right, title and interest in relation to which have vested
label: body

text: in the State Government under sub-section (1) of section 3, shall—
label: body

text: (a) by virtue of the provisions of sub-section (2) of section 3, vest in the
label: body

text: Corporation or in such person and to such extent or limitations as the Corporation may by
label: body

text: order in writing, specify ; or
label: body

text: (b) where  a direction has been issued by the State Government under sub-section

text: (1) of section 6, vest in the new Government company or in such person and to such

label: body

label: body

text: CHAPTER V
label: H2

text: P ROVISIONS RELATING TO E MOLOYEES OF THE P ROPRIETORS
label: H3

text: (1) Where services of a person who is a workman within the meaning of the
label: body

text: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, and who has been, immediately before the appointed day,
label: body

text: employed in the undertaking, are, in the opinion of the Corporation necessary having regard
label: body

text: to requirements of the units restructured as a result of re-organisation of the undertaking, he
label: body

text: shall become, from the date of his apointment by the Corporation, an employee of the
label: body

text: Corporation and shall hold office or service in the Corporation with the same rights and
label: body

text: privileges as to pension, gratuity and other matters as would have been admissible to him if
label: body

text: the rights in relation to the undertaking had not been transferred to, and vested in, the
label: body

text: Corporation and continue to do so unless and until his employment in such Corporation is
label: body

text: duly terminated or until his remuneration and terms and conditions of employment are duly
label: body

text: altered by the Corporation.

text: ( a ) The services of  every person employed by the proprietor before the appointed
label: body

text: day shall  stand terminated—
label: body

text: ( i ) on the designated date if such person is not employed before that date by the
label: body

text: Corporation under sub-section ( 1 ) or ( 2 ), and
label: body

text: ( ii ) on the date of his appointment if such person is employed before the designated
label: body

text: date by the Corporation under sub-section  ( 1 ) or ( 2 ).
label: body

text: A person whose services stand terminated under sub-clause ( i ) of clause ( a ) shall
label: body

text: not be entitled to claim employment in the Corporation as of right.
label: body

text: ( a ) Every person whose services stand terminated under sub-clause ( i ) of clause
label: body

text: ( a ) of sub-section ( 3 ) shall be entitled to—
label: body

text: ( i ) payment of gratuity and of compensation for retrenchment or closure in accor-
label: body

text: dance with the provisions of the Payment of Gratuity Act, 1972 and the Industrial Desputes
label: body

text: Act, 1947 if he is a workman within the meaning of the latter Act, and
label: body

text: ( ii ) payment of gratuity if he is not such a workman :
label: body

text: Provided that, no person whose services are terminated on his superannuation on or
label: body

text: before the designated date, shall be entitled to payment of compensation for
label: body

text: retrenchment.
label: body

text: (b) Notwithstanding anything contained in Chapter VI and notwithstanding that the
label: body

text: liability for payment of gratuity and compensation for retrenchment or closure under clause
label: body

text: (a) is that of the proprietors such liability shall be discharged by the State Government or the
label: body

text: Corporation, according to the order of priorities mentioned in the Schedule and on discharge
label: body

text: of such liability by the State Government or the Corporation the proprietors shall stand
label: body

text: discharged to the extent of the liability so discharged.
label: body

text: (5) Where,—
label: body

text: (a) the services of any person employed before the appointed day in the undertaking
label: body

text: are terminated.—
label: body

text: (i) under the terms of any contract or service or otherwise, or
label: body

text: (ii) under sub-section (3), and
label: body

text: (b) such person is entitled to any arrears of salary or wages or any payment for any
label: body

text: leave not availed of or other payment not being payment by way of gratuity or compen-

text: sation for retrenchment,

text: 39 of

text: such person may, except to the extent such liability of payment has been discharged by the

text: against the proprietors of the undertaking but not against the State Government or the
label: body

text: Corporation :

text: Provided that, notwithstanding anything contained in the Industrial Disputes Act,
label: body

text: 1947, the Payment of Wages Act, 1936, and the Payment of Gratuity Act, 1972,––

text: ( a ) the State Government or the Corporation shall not be liable,—

text: ( i ) to any person who has become an employee of the Corporation under
label: body

text: sub-section ( 1 ) for payment of gratuity or any arrears of wages, or

text: ( ii ) to any person whose services stand terminated under sub-clause (i) of clause
label: body

text: (a) of sub-section (3) for payment of gratuity or any arrears of wages or compensation
label: body

text: for retrenchment or closure,

label: body

text: be, on which  his services stand terminated irrespective of whether such closure was in

text: accordance with the provisions of  the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947 or not ;

label: body

text: sub-section (3) on his becoming an employee of the Corporation under sub-section ( 1 ) shall
label: body

text: not entitle such person to payment of any gratuity.

text: Explanation .––In this Chapter––

text: ( a ) the expression “Corporation” includes “ new Government company ” ; and
label: body

text: ( b ) the expression “ designated date ’’ means such date as the State Government may,
label: body

text: by notification in the Official Gazette, designate.
label: body

text: (1) Where the proprietors have established a provident fund, superannuation fund,
label: body

text: welfare fund or any other fund for the benefit of the persons employed in the undertaking,
label: body

text: the monies relatable to the officers or other employees, whose services have been continued
label: body

label: body

text: the credit of such provident fund, superannuation fund, welfare fund or other fund, stand
label: body

text: transferred to and  vested in, the Corporation.
label: body

text: (2) The monies which stand transferred under sub-section ( 1 ) to the Corporation shall
label: body

text: be dealt with by the Corporation in such manner as may be prescribed.

text: CHAPTER VI
label: H2

text: C OMMISSIONER O F P AYMENTS
label: H3

text: (1) The State Government shall, for the purpose of disbursing the amounts
label: body

text: payable under sections 7 and 8 to the proprietors, by notification in the Official Gazette,
label: body

text: appoint a Commissioner of Payments.
label: body

text: (2) The State Government may appoint such other persons as it may think fit to assist
label: body

text: the Commissioner and thereupon the Commissioner may authorise one or more of such
label: body

text: persons also to exercise all or any of the powers exercisable by him under this Act and
label: body

text: different persons may be authorised to exercise different powers.
label: body

text: (3) Any person authorised  by the Commissioner to exercise any of the powers exercis-
label: body

text: able by the Commissioner may exercise those powers in the same manner and with the same
label: body

text: effect as if they have been conferred on that person directly by this Act and not by way of
label: body

text: authorisation.
label: body

text: (4) The  salaries and allowances of the Commissioner and other persons appointed
label: body

text: under this section shall be defrayed out of the Consolidated Fund of the State.
label: body

text: (1) The State  Government shall, within thirty days from the specified date pay in
label: body

text: cash to the Commissioner for Payment to the proprietors,––
label: body

text: (a) an amount equal to the amount specified in section 7, after deducting there-
label: body

text: from any amount paid under clause (b) of sub-section ( 4 ) of section 12 ; and
label: body

text: (b) an amount equal to the  amount payable to the proprietors under section 8.
label: body

text: (2) A deposit account shall be opened by the State Government in favour of the
label: body

text: Commissioner in the Public Account of the  State, and every amount paid under this Act to
label: body

text: the Commissioner shall be deposited by him to the credit of the said deposit account and the
label: body

text: said deposit account shall be operated by the Commissioner.
label: body

text: (3) Records shall be maintained by the Commissioner in respect of the undertaking in
label: body

text: relation to which payment has been made to him under this Act.
label: body

text: (4) The interest accruing on the amount standing to the credit of the deposit account
label: body

text: referred to in sub-section ( 2 ) shall accrue to the benefit of the proprietors.
label: body

text: (1) The State  Government or the Corporation or, where a direction has been issued
label: body

text: by the State Government under sub-section ( 1 ) of section 6, the new Government company,
label: body

text: as the case may be, shall be entitled to receive up to the specified date, to the exclusion of all

text: other persons, any money due to the proprietors, in relations to their undertaking which has

text: vested in the State Government, or the Corporation or in the new Government company, and
label: body

text: realised after the appointed day, notwithstanding that the realisation pertains to a  period
label: body

text: prior to the appointed day.
label: body

text: (2) The State Government or the Corporation or the new Government company, as the
label: body

text: case may be, may make a claim to the Commissioner with regard to every payment made by
label: body

text: it after the appointed day, not being payment made under the proviso to section 7, for
label: body

text: discharging any liability of the proprietors, in relation to any period prior to the appointed
label: body

text: day, and every such  claim shall have priority, in accordance with the priorities attaching,
label: body

text: under this Act, to the matter in relation to which such liability has been discharged by the
label: body

text: State Government, or the Corporation or the new Government company.
label: body

text: (3) Save as otherwise provided in this Act, the liabilities of the proprietors in respect of
label: body

text: any period prior to the appointed day, shall be the liabilities of the proprietors.
label: body

text: Every person having a claim other than the claim relating to gratuity or compensa-
label: body

text: tion for retrenchment or closure against the proprietors with regard to any of the matters
label: body

text: specified in the Schedule pertaining to the undertaking, shall prefer such claim before the
label: body

text: Commissioner within thirty days from the specified date :
label: body

text: Provided that, if the Commissioner is satisfied that the claimant was prevented by suffi-
label: body

text: cient cause from preferring the claim within the said period of thirty days, he may entertain
label: body

text: the claim within a further period of thirty days  but not thereafter.
label: body

text: The claims arising out of the matters specified in the Schedule shall have priorities
label: body

text: in accordances with the following principles, namely :—
label: body

text: (a) category I shall have precedence over all other categories and category II shall
label: body

text: have precedence over categories III and IV ; and category III shall have precedence over
label: body

text: category IV ;
label: body

text: (b) the claims arising out of matters specified in each category except category III
label: body

text: shall rank equally and be paid in full, but if the amount is insufficient to meet such claims
label: body

text: in full, they shall abate in equal proportions and be paid accordingly;
label: body

text: (c) the liabilities specified in category III shall be discharged in the manner agreed to
label: body

text: by the State Government of one part with the banks and institutions of other part subject
label: body

text: to the priorities specified in this section, in accordance with the terms of the secured loans
label: body

text: and the priority inter se of such loans ; and
label: body

text: Claims to
label: body

text: be made to
label: body

text: Commis-
label: body

text: sioner.
label: body

text: Priority of
label: body

text: claims.
label: body

text: (d) the question of  payment of a liability with regard to a matter specified in a lower
label: body

text: category shall arise only if a surplus is left after meeting all the liabilities specified in the
label: body

text: immediately higher category.
label: body

text: (1) On receipt of the claims made under section 17, the Commissioner shall arrange
label: body

text: the claims in the order of priorities specified in the Schedule and examine the same in
label: body

text: accordance with such order of priorities.
label: body

text: (2) If, on examination of the claims, the Commissioner is of opinion that the amount paid
label: body

text: to him under this Act, is not sufficient to meet the liabilities specified in any lower category,
label: body

text: he shall not be required to examine the claims in respect of such lower category.
label: body

text: (1) After examining  the claims with reference to the priorities set out in the
label: body

text: Schedule, the Commissioner shall fix a date on or before which every claimant shall file the
label: body

text: proof of his claim or be excluded from the benefit of the disbursement made by the
label: body

text: Commissioner.
label: body

text: ( 2 ) Not less than fourteen days’ notice of the date so fixed shall be given by
label: body

text: advertisement in one issue of such daily newspaper in the English language, and one issue
label: body

text: of such daily newspaper in the Marathi language as the Commissioner may consider
label: body

text: suitable, and every such notice shall call upon the claimant to file the proof of his claim with
label: body

text: the Commissioner within the period specified in the advertisement.
label: body

text: ( 3 ) Every claimant, who fails to file the proof of his claim within the period specified by
label: body

text: the Commissioner shall be excluded from the disbursements made by the Commissioner.
label: body

text: ( 4 ) The Commissioner shall, after such investigation as may, in his opinion, be necessary
label: body

text: and after giving the proprietors an opportunity of refuting the claims and after giving the
label: body

text: claimant a reasonable opportunity of being heard, admit or reject, by order in writing, the
label: body

text: claim in whole or in part.
label: body

text: ( 5 ) The Commissioner shall have the power to regulate his own procedure in all matters
label: body

text: arising out of the discharge of his functions, including the place or places at which he may
label: body

text: hold his sittings and shall, for the purpose of making an investigation under this Act, have
label: body

text: the same powers as are vested in a civil court under the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, while
label: body

text: trying a suit, in respect of the following matters, namely :—
label: body

text: ( a ) the summoning and enforcing the attendance of any witness and examining him
label: body

text: on oath ;
label: body

text: ( b ) the discovery and production of any document or other material object producible
label: body

text: as evidence ;
label: body

text: ( c ) the reception of evidence on affidavits ; and
label: body

text: ( d ) the issuing of any commission for the examination of witnesses.
label: body

text: ( 6 ) Any investigation before the Commissioner shall be deemed to be a judicial proceed-
label: body

text: ing within the meaning of sections 193 and 228 of the Indian Penal Code, and the Commis-
label: body

text: sioner shall be deemed to be a civil court for the purposes of section 195 and Chapter XXVI
label: body

text: of  the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
label: body

text: ( 7 ) A claimant, who is dissatisfied with the decision of the Commissioner, may prefer an
label: body

text: appeal against such decision to the principal civil court of original jurisdiction within the
label: body

text: local limits of whose jurisdiction the registerd office of the proprietors is situated :
label: body

text: Provided that, where a person who is a Judge of a High Court is appointed to be the
label: body

text: Commissioner, such appeal shall lie to the High Court of Bombay and such appeal shall be
label: body

text: heard and disposed of by not less than two Judges of that High Court.
label: body

text: After admitting a claim under this Act, the amount due in respect of such claim shall
label: body

text: be credited by the Commissioner to the relevant fund or be paid to the person or persons to
label: body

text: whom such amount is due, and on such credit or payment, the liability of the proprietors in
label: body

text: respect of such claim shall stand discharged.
label: body

text: If, out of the monies paid to him in relation to the undertaking, there is a balance left
label: body

text: after meeting the liabilities as specified in the Schedule, the Commisssioner shall disburse
label: body

text: such balance to the proprietors.
label: body

text: Where the possession of any machinery , equipment or other property has vested
label: body

text: in the State Government, or Corporation, or new Government company under this Act, but
label: body

text: such machinery, equipment or other property does not belong to the proprietors, it shall be
label: body

text: lawful for the State Government or the Corporation or such Government company to
label: body

text: continue to possess such machinery or equipment or other property on the same terms and
label: body

text: conditions under which they were possessed by the proprietors immediately before the
label: body

text: appointed day.
label: body

text: Any money paid to the Commissioner which remains undisbursed or unclaimed on
label: body

text: the date immediately preceding the date on which the office of the Commissioner is finally
label: body

text: wound up, shall be transferred by the Commissioner before his office is finally wound up, to
label: body

text: the general revenue account of the State Government ; but a claim to any money so
label: body

text: transferred may be preferred to the State Government by the person intitled to such payment
label: body

text: and shall be dealt with as if such transfer had not been made, and the order, if any, for
label: body

text: payment of the claim, being treated as an order for the refund of revenue.

text: CHAPTER  VII
label: H2

text: M ISCELLANEOUS
label: H3

text: ( 1 ) Where any liability of the proprietors arising out of any item specified in
label: body

text: category I of the Schedule is not discharged fully by the Commissioner out of the amount
label: body

text: paid under this Act, the Commissioner shall intimate in writing to the State Government the
label: body

text: extent of the liability which remains undischarged and that liability shall be assumed by the
label: body

text: State Government.
label: body

text: ( 2 ) The State Government may, by order, direct the Corporation to take over any liability
label: body

text: assumed by the Government under sub-section (1) and on receipt of such direction, it shall
label: body

text: be the duty of the Corporation to discharge such liability.
label: body

text: The provisions of this Act shall have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent
label: body

text: therewith contained in any other law for the time being in force or in any instrument having
label: body

text: effect by virtue of any law, other than this Act or in any decree or order of any court, tribunal
label: body

text: or  other authority.
label: body

text: Every contract entered into by the proprietors in relation to their undertaking, which
label: body

text: has vested in the State Government under section 3, for any service, sale or supply, and in
label: body

text: force immediately before the appointed day, shall on and from the expiry of one hundred and
label: body

text: eighty days from the appointed day, cease to have effect unless such contract is, before the
label: body

text: expiry of that period, ratified, in writing by the State Government, or the Corporation, or new
label: body

text: Government company, in which such undertaking has been vested under this Act, and in
label: body

text: ratifying such contract, the State Government, or the Corporation or the new Government
label: body

text: company, as the case may be, may make such alteration or modification therein as it may
label: body

text: think fit:
label: body

text: Provided that, the State Government, or the Corporation, or the new Government
label: body

text: company shall not omit to ratify a contract and shall not make any alteration  or modification
label: body

text: in a contract,—
label: body

text: (a) unless it is satisfied that such contract is unduly onerous, or has been entered
label: body

text: into in bad faith, or is detrimental to the interest of the State Government, or the Corpora-
label: body

text: tion or the new Government company ; and
label: body

text: (b) except after giving the parties to the contract a reasonable opportunity of being
label: body

text: heard  and except after recording in writing its reasons for refusal to ratify the contract or
label: body

text: for making any alteration or modification therein.
label: body

text: No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against the State   Govern-
label: body

text: ment, or the Corporation, or the new Government company or any officer or other employee
label: body

text: of that Government, or the Corporation or the new Government company, or other person
label: body

text: authorised by the State Government or the Corporation,  or the new Government company
label: body

text: for anything, including any damage caused or likely to be caused by anything , which is in
label: body

text: good faith done or intended to be done under this Act.

text: (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking)
label: body

text: (1) The  State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette , direct that
label: body

text: all or any of the powers exercisable by it under this Act, other  than the powers conferred by
label: body

text: this section, section 33 and section 34, may also be exercised by such person or persons as
label: body

text: may be specified in the notification.
label: body

text: (2) Whenever any delegation of power is made under sub-section (1) , the persons to
label: body

text: whom such power has been delegated shall act under the direction, control and supervision
label: body

text: of the State Government.
label: body

text: Any person who,—
label: body

text: ( a ) having in his possession, custody or control any property forming part of the
label: body

text: undertaking wrongfully withholds such property from the State Government or the
label: body

text: Corporation or the new Government company or any person or body of persons specified
label: body

text: by the State Government, Corporation or, as the case may be, new Government comapany,
label: body

text: in this behalf ; or
label: body

text: ( b ) wrongfully obtains possession of, or retains, any property forming part of the
label: body

text: undertaking ; or
label: body

text: ( c ) wilfully withholds or fails to furnish to the State Government, or the Corporation,
label: body

text: or the new Government company, as the case may be, or any person or body of persons
label: body

text: specified by that Govenment, or the Corporation or the new Government company, any
label: body

text: document relating to the undertaking, which may be in his possession, custody  or
label: body

text: control ; or
label: body

text: ( d ) fails to deliver to the State Government, or the Corporation, or the new
label: body

text: Government company, as the case may be, or to any person or body of persons specified
label: body

text: by that Govenment, or the Corporation, or the new Government company, any assets,
label: body

text: books of account, registers or other documents in his possession, custody or
label: body

text: control relating to the undertaking ; or
label: body

text: (e) wrongfully removes or destroys any property forming part of the
label: body

text: undertaking ; or
label: body

text: (f) wrongfully prefers any claim under this Act which he knows or has reasonable
label: body

text: cause to believe to be false or grossly inaccurate ;
label: body

text: shall, on conviction, be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two
label: body

text: years, or with fine which may extend to ten thousand rupees, or with both.
label: body

text: (1) Where an offence under this Act has been committed by a company, every
label: body

text: person, who, at the time when the offence was committed, was in charge of, and was
label: body

text: responsible to, the company, for the conduct of the business of the company, as well as the
label: body

text: company, shall be deemed to be guilty or the offence and shall be liable to be proceeded
label: body

text: against and punished accordingly :
label: body

text: Delegation
label: body

text: 1986 : Mah.XLVI]

text: Central India Spinning, Weaving and  Manufacturing
label: body

text: Company Limited, The Empress Mills, Nagpur
label: body

text: (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking)
label: body

text: Provided that, nothing contained in this sub-section shall render any such person liable
label: body

text: to any punishment, if he proves that the offence was committed without his knowledge or
label: body

text: that he had exercised all due diligence to prevent the commission of such offence.
label: body

text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1) where any offence under
label: body

text: this Act has been committed by a company and it is proved that the offence has been
label: body

text: committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of,
label: body

text: any director, manager, secretary or other officer of the company, such director, manager,
label: body

text: secretary or other officer shall be deemed to be guilty of the offence and shall be liable to be
label: body

text: proceeded against and puished accordingly.
label: body

text: Explanation .—For the purposes of this section,—
label: body

text: ( a ) “company” means any body corporate, and includes a firm or other association of
label: body

text: individuals ; and
label: body

text: ( b ) “director” in relation to a firm, means a partner in the firm.
label: body

text: No proceeding for the winding up of the company, the right, title and interest in
label: body

text: relation to the undertaking owned by which, have vested in the State Government or the
label: body

text: Corporation or the new Government company  under this Act shall lie or be proceeded with
label: body

text: in any Court except with the consent of the State Government.
label: body

text: (1) The State Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette , make rules
label: body

text: for carrying out the provisions of this Act.
label: body

text: In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such
label: body

text: rules may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely :—
label: body

text: ( a ) the time within which, and the manner in which, an intimation referred to in
label: body

text: sub-section (3) of section 4 shall be given be given to the Commissioner ;
label: body

text: (b) the manner in which the monies in any provident fund or other fund under
label: body

text: section 13 shall be dealt with ;
label: body

text: (c) any other matter which is required to be, or may be, prescribed.
label: body

text: (3) Every rule made by the State Government under this Act shall be laid, as soon as may
label: body

text: be, after it is made, before each House of the State Legislature, while it is in session, for a total
label: body

text: period of thirty days which may be comprised in one session or in two or more successive
label: body

text: sessions, and if, before the expiry of the session immediatedly following the session or the
label: body

text: successive sessions aforesaid, both Houses agree in making any modification in the rule or
label: body

text: both Houses agree that the rule should not be made, then on publication of such decision in
label: body

text: the Official Gazette, the rule shall have effect only in such modified form or be of no effect,
label: body

text: as the case may be ;  so, however, that any such modification or annulment shall be without
label: body

text: prejudice to the validity of anything previously done under that rule.
label: body

text: Company
label: body

text: not to be
label: body

text: wound up by
label: body

text: Company Limited, The Empress Mills, Nagpur

text: (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking)
label: body

text: If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of this Act, the State
label: body

text: Government may, by order, not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, remove the
label: body

text: difficulty :
label: body

text: Provided that, no such order shall be made after the expiry of the period of two years, from
label: body

text: the date of commencement of this Act.
label: body

text: (1) The Central India Spinning, Weaving and Manufacturing Company Limited,
label: body

text: the Empress Mills, Nagpur (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertaking) Ordinance, 1986, is
label: body

text: hereby repealed.
label: body

text: (2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken (including any rule
label: body

text: made, order or notification issued or any appointment made or direction issued) under the
label: body

text: said Ordinance shall be deemed to have been done, taken, issued or made, as the case may
label: body

text: be, under the corresponsding provisions of this Act.
label: body
